title: Law ministry notifies appointments of chief justices of four high courts
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 07 (APP):The Ministry of Law and Justice on Monday issued notifications regarding the appointments of the chief justices of the four high courts of the country.
As per the notifications, Mr Justice Sardar Muhammad Sarfraz Dogar is appointed as Chief Justice of the Islamabad High Court (IHC), Mr Justice Muhammad Junaid Ghaffar is appointed Chief Justice of the High Court of Sindh (HCS), Mr Justice Rozi Khan Barrech as Chief Justice of the High Court of Balochistan and Mr Justice S M Attique Shah as Chief Justice of the Peshawar High Court (PHC).
The notifications said that â€œIn exercise of the powers conferred under clause (1) of the Article 193 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, is pleased to make aforesaid appointments with effect from the date they (judges) makes oath of their offices.
